title: commission
body:
An image that was drawn as a paid commission, i.e. when someone hires an artist to draw for them.

Make sure the word 'commission' is visible in the image, or is mentioned in artist commentary, if you have no other proof.

If the post was commissioned on specific image site, apply the tags of where the commission was made accordingly.

This tag is for personal commissions; for commissions for a company, commercial work or otherwise established copyright, use [[official art]] instead.

h4. Commission sites

* [[ko-fi commission]]
* [[pixiv commission]]
* [[skeb commission]]
* [[vgen commission]]
* [[fiverr commission]]

h4. See also

* [[art trade]]
* [[commissioner insert]]
* [[commissioner name]]
* [[commissioner upload]]
* [[gift art]]
* [[guest art]]
* [[request inset]]
* [[second-party source]]
* [[third-party source]]

title: commissioner_upload
body:
A work that was uploaded to Danbooru by the person who [[commission]]ed it.

If the work was received privately from the artist rather than being publicly posted, or that it is different from version publicly posted by the artist (such as having higher resolution, lack of censorship, watermark, etc.), then the source may be left blank, left as the filename, or description of where the commission was delivered. [[Non-web source]] tag may be applicable if the artist have not posted that version of the work online.

If the work was posted to another site by the commissioner, please use [[second-party source]] instead.

title: marida_cruz
body:
A character in [i][[Gundam Unicorn]][/i], [b]Marida Cruz[/b] was originally known as "[[puru_12|Ple Twelve]]", a clone of [[Elpeo Puru]]. Marida was awakened by [[Glemy Toto]] and fought with her sisters during the first [[Neo Zeon]] movement. 

After the fight with [[Chara Soon]] in U.C.0089.1.17, [spoiler]she was one of the only surviving clones and was later taken by slave traders. She was later sold into sex slavery, in a colony brothel. Although her handlers thought she was too young to be a prostitute, the Madam thought there are pedophiles that would be interested in such youth.[/spoiler] 

Before coming under the protection of [[Suberoa Zinnerman]], [spoiler]Marida experienced countless pregnancies and abortions and her body is scarred from the abuse of her brutal customers.[/spoiler] Afterwards, she was rescued and taken in by a [[Neo Zeon]] faction to become a [[mobile_suit|MS]] pilot once again.

Nelson's outfit consist a [[microdress]] military uniform and [[red jacket|red]] [[military jacket]] with [[epaulettes]] on each shoulders.

Her physical appearance includes [[red eyes]], [[very long hair|absurdly long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[black ribbon]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[twin drills]] in the end, along with [[red thighhighs]] with [[rudder footwear]] and also her [[large breasts|sizable chest]] showing her [[cleavage]].

She has [[green eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] stylized in [[short twintails]] with [[sidelocks]] & [[parted bangs]]. Wears [[glasses]], a [[green hat|green]] [[military hat|military]] [[beret]], [[red thighhighs]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[boots]].

title: gaen_izuko
body:
Gaen Izuko is a mentor and leader of sorts to the other "oddity" specialists in the [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]]: [[Oshino Meme]], [[Kaiki Deishuu]], [[Kagenui Yozuru]], and [[Teori Tadatsuru]], who also comprised her "Occult Research Club" in college. She has a reputation for being powerful and knowledgeable in the series, and her catch phrase is "I know everything".  She is the younger sister of [[Gaen Tooe]] and aunt of [[Kanbaru Suruga]].

Appearance-wise, she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that typically [[hair over one eye|covers one of her]] [[brown eyes]].  Her typical attire is hip-hop inspired, consisting of a [[green hat|green]] and [[white hat|white]] [[baseball cap]] as a [[hat]] (often [[sideways hat|worn sideways]]), a [[green shirt|green]] [[off shoulder|off]][[off-shoulder shirt|-shoulder]] [[t-shirt|t-]][[shirt]], [[red pants]], and dark [[red footwear|red]] [[flats]] for [[shoes]].  For accessories, she usually wears red [[prayer beads]], a yellow [[star (symbol)|star-shaped]] [[pendant]] [[necklace]], black [[wristband]]s, orange and yellow [[headphones]] (usually [[headphones around neck|around her neck]]), and carries multiple [[smartphone]]s.

She wears a standard [[serafuku|sailor uniform]] of [[white shirt]], [[red neckerchief]], and dark/black [[pleated skirt]].  In addition, she sports [[red thighhighs]], chest protectors resembling muneate, and a turqoise-colored [[single gauntlet]] on her left arm.  She has [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]].

title: world_tre@sure_(idolmaster)
body:
A series of costumes in [[idolmaster side-m live on stage!|THE iDOLM@STER SIDEM: Live on Stage!]] representing the outfits worn for the WORLD TRE@SURE events. Tag may also refer to the groupings of the event.

h4. List of outfits
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in France -[/b] A [[uniform]] evoking [[The Three Musketeers]]. Includes a [[blue cape|blue]] [[capelet]] with white [[fur trim]], a blue and white [[cavalier hat]]. Includes a [[rapier]], a blue [[sash]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]].
** Worn by: [[Tendo Teru]], [[Akuno Hideo]], [[Akai Suzaku]], and [[Kuzunoha Amehiko]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in America -[/b] [[Overalls]] with a [[striped]] [[crop top]] and a [[boater hat]], with [[striped socks]], [[boots]], a [[single glove|single]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless glove]]. Comes with [[button badge]]s and [[bandana]]s as accessories.
** Worn by: [[Aoi Yusuke]], [[Kimura Ryu]], and [[Wakazato Haruna]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Spain -[/b] [[Matador]] costume.
** Worn by: [[Tachibana Shiro (idolmaster)|]], [[Hazama Michio]], and [[Kizaki Ren]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in China -[/b] [[Chinese Clothes]]; nontraditional [[changpao]] with [[capri pants]] and a golden [[hair flower]] with a [[tassel]].
** Worn by: [[Mitarai Shouta]], [[Watanabe Minori]], [[Taiga Takeru]], and [[Kabuto Daigo]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Hawaii -[/b] [[Floral print]] tops with [[midriff]], swimwear, [[visor cap]], and [[sandals]].
** Worn by: [[Mizushima Saki]], [[Himeno Kanon]], and [[Maita Rui]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Germany -[/b] [[German clothes]]; white [[ascot]], [[hat]], open [[red jacket]].
** Worn by: [[Ijuuin Hokuto]], [[Tsuzuki Kei]], [[Fuyumi Jun]], and [[Asselin BB II]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Finland -[/b] [[White coat]], [[ushanka]], [[black gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].
** Worn by: [[Pierre Bichelberger]], [[Sakaki Natsuki]], [[Aoi Kyosuke]], and [[Kiyosumi Kuro]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Canada -[/b] [[Earmuffs]], [[vest]], [[detached sleeves]] with [[fur trim]], [[red socks|red]] [[kneehighs]], [[white pants]]/[[white shorts]], and [[boots]]
** Worn by: [[Okamura Nao]], [[Uzuki Makio]], [[Kagura Rei]], and [[Akiyama Hayato]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Russia -[/b] [[Ushanka]], [[military uniform]] with [[epaulettes]] and [[aiguillette|aiguillettes]], and [[white gloves]].
** Worn by: [[Kamiya Yukihiro]], [[Yamashita Jiro]], and [[Koron Chris]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Thailand -[/b] Thai clothing.
** Worn by: [[Kashiwagi Tsubasa]], [[Hanamura Shoma]], [[Shinonome Soichiro]], and [[Enjoji Michiru]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in India -[/b] [[Indian clothes]]; [[turban]], [[patterned clothing]], [[earrings]] with other various [[jewelry]] ([[bangle|bangles]], [[necklace]], [[ring|rings]]).
** Worn by: [[Akizuki Ryo]], [[Amagase Touma]], and [[Nekoyanagi Kirio]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in United Kingdom -[/b] [[Blue jacket]] with [[capelet]], [[double-breasted]] [[waistcoat]], [[top hat]], [[striped necktie]] or [[striped bowtie]], and [[white gloves]].
** Worn by: [[Kurono Genbu]], [[Sakuraba Kaoru]], and [[Tsukumo Kazuki]]
* [b]WORLD TRE@SURE in Japan -[/b] [[Japanese clothes]]; [[Crop top]] under [[igote]], [[headband]], and [[baggy pants]].
** Worn by: [[Takajo Kyoji]], [[Kitamura Sora]], [[Shingen Seiji]], and [[Iseya Shiki]]

title: harukawa_maki
body:
Character from [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]].

The Ultimate Child Caregiver. She was raised in an orphanage and often had to take care of the children younger than her there; despite this, she does not like children. A mostly coolheaded girl. Although she was initially shown as a primary character along with [[Momota Kaito]] and [[K1-b0]] in early promotional materials, neither of the three were the true protagonist.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] divided into [[low twintails]] by two [[red scrunchie|red]] [[hair scrunchie|hair scrunchies]]. Her [[school uniform]] is a red [[serafuku]] with a black [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], and wears [[red thighhighs]]. She has a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]].

[spoiler]At the end of Chapter 2, it is revealed that she is actually the Ultimate Assassin, using the title of Ultimate Child Caregiver as a cover to hide this.[/spoiler]

title: yatadera_narumi
body:
[b]Magical Jizo who Manifested in the Forest[/b]

[i][[Touhou]][/i] character introduced as the stage 4 boss in [i][[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]][/i].

She has [[long earlobes]], [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]] tied in [[twin braids|two braids]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[snow]]-covered [[ajirogasa]] along with a [[grey dress]] adorned with big red [[buttons]]. A [[capelet]] is wrapped around her neck with a [[ribbon]]. The [[clothes writing|writing]] on her capelet reads "畢竟成佛", meaning "ultimate attainment of Buddhahood". She dons a pair of [[sandals]] with [[red socks]] while standing on her [[tiptoes]]. Her portrait depicts her [[own hands together|holding her hands together]].

Originally a "jizou":[/wiki_pages/jizou] statue, she came to life and became a magician of the Forest of Magic. She's friends with [[kirisame marisa|Marisa]], who calls her "Naruko" by mistake at times. Her abilities let her control the life force of living things.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Yatadera Narumi":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Narumi_Yatadera

title: howa_type_64_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Japanese-made [[Howa Type 64]] [[battle rifle]] in the game [[Girls' Frontline]].

A slightly aloof, yet easygoing girl. She has [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[blunt ends]] and long, luxurious [[drill sidelocks]], all topped with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]. 

Her main outfit is reminiscent of a formal [[school uniform]], with an upper portion composed of a [[red necktie]], an [[untucked shirt|untucked]] [[white shirt]], and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[cropped jacket]] with white [[wrist cuffs]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and a [[belt pouch]] attached to tactical [[strap|straps]] which also serve as a belt.

The lower half of the outfit is a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|dark blue]] [[lace-trimmed skirt]], [[red pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[combat boots]].

h4. Appearance

title: metropolitan_museum_(song)
body:
メトロポリタン美術館 (reading is given as メトロポリタン ミュージアム,  Metropolitan Museum)

A popular song of [[minna_no_uta_(nhk)|Minna no Uta]], written/composed/sung by "Oonuki (Ōnuki) Taeko":http://onukitaeko.jp/ and stop motion animation by "Okamoto Tadanari.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tadanari_Okamoto 
It is said that its fantastical lyrics/story was inspired by "“From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler”.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/From_the_Mixed-Up_Files_of_Mrs._Basil_E._Frankweiler  (Japanese title: "クローディアの秘密)":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?word=%E3%82%AF%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%87%E3%82%A3%E3%82%A2%E3%81%AE%E7%A7%98%E5%AF%86&s_mode=s_tag_full

* Nameless girl wearing a red [[hat]] and [[red socks]]
* A [[statue]] of an [[angel]] holding a [[violin]]

title: tewoarao-!
body:
A series of images in which beautiful girls, including anime characters, were used in [[poster (medium)|]]s produced by the Saitama prefectural government's medical maintenance division to promote the prevention of O-157 between 2001 and 2002.

Arguably the most notable posters produced during this time featured the characters of [[Azumanga Daioh]] illustrated by series creator [[Azuma Kiyohiko]] depicting [[Kasuga Ayumu]] looking [[looking at viewer|obliquely upward]] with both [[outstretched hand|hands stretched out]] [[outstretched arms|to the front]], with "手を洗おー!" (Tewoaro-! - meaning "[[washing|Wash]] your hands!) inscribed with cute letters.

These were posted on public facilities in Saitama Prefecture, and in the [[bus]]es that traveled around the prefecture. Inspired by the public relations campaign, [[parody|parodies]] made with many characters have become popular on the [[Internet]]. In 2019, parodies of these posters made a resurgence due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

title: driver_(drive)
body:
The unnamed protagonist of the 2011 film [[Drive_(movie)|]], played by [[Ryan Gosling]].

The Driver's most iconic outfit is a [[white_jacket|white satin jacket]] with an embroidered gold [[scorpion]] on the back, accompanied with driving [[gloves]], skinny tight black [[jeans]] and light colored madison [[boots]]. He also carries a [[hammer]] for a weapon.

The Driver is known for being quiet, reclusive and emotionally isolated. His personality traits have been perceived as "relatable" by those who have watched the film, resulting in the Driver being lauded through internet discourse. Examples include memes and video edits of the film's scenes depicting the Driver as "literally me" to viewers. [[k_(blade_runner_2049)|Officer K]], another character [[Ryan Gosling]] has played in [[Blade Runner 2049]], also shares many similarities to the Driver, and are often featured together in memes along with other film characters Gosling has played over his career.

h4. See also

* [[Goslingposting (meme)]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Drive (2011 film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drive_(2011_film)

title: viewer_holding_leash
body:
A [[POV]] image where the viewer is holding a character's [[leash]].

The holding end of the leash must be held by the viewer, or at least implied. The receiving end of the leash must be on a character.

If the hands holding the leash are visible, add [[holding leash]] and [[pov hands]].

h4. See also

* [[bdsm]]
* [[viewer on leash]]

title: viewer_on_leash
body:
A [[POV]] image where the viewer is on the receiving end of a [[leash]].

The leash should be going to where the viewer's neck should be. The leash can be made of anything as long as the intent is to use it as a leash.

If a character's hands holding the leash on the viewer are visible, add [[holding leash]].

h4. See also

* [[femdom]]
* [[viewer holding leash]]

title: tashkent_(kancolle)
body:
A character from [[Kantai Collection]], introduced in the 2018 Winter Event. Based on the Soviet destroyer leader Tashkent.

h4. Appearance

She has wide [[brown eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied off into [[low twintails|low]] [[twintails]] with [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|hair bows]], wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[papakha]] with three [[star (symbol)|]]s on it, a [[torn scarf|tattered]] [[white scarf|white]] [[scarf]] and a [[ribbon trim|ribbon-trimmed]] [[blue shawl|blue]] [[shawl]] over a [[white jacket|white]] [[jacket]] and an [[anchor necklace]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[skirt]], a couple of [[black belt|black]] [[belt]]s, an [[untucked shirt|untucked]] [[red shirt]], [[brown pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]].

Her rigging includes a pair of [[ship turret|turrets]] and a pair of triple-tube [[torpedo tubes|torpedo launchers]].

In her appearance in the 2019 calendar (post #3431552), she is portrayed as significantly taller than [[hibiki (kancolle)|Hibiki]].

h4. Personality

In-game, she has a generically friendly and reliable personality. She consistently refers to the admiral and other shipgirls as "Comrades", conforming to the communist model. In fan-art, the fact that she was built in Italy is rarely shown unless this is directly refered to, often making her the zealous, "more communist than thou" character compared to newcomer [[hibiki (kancolle)|Hibiki]]/[[verniy (kancolle)|Verniy]] and imperial-era old guard [[Gangut (kancolle)|]]. On the opposite end, you can have "the sweetest Tashkent around":[/pools/14819].

h4. History

The Tashkent class of ships consisted of a single destroyer leader, built in Italy for the Soviet navy just before World War II. Three other ships were ordered but canceled before construction. The class is named after Tashkent, "the capital city":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tashkent] of the Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic (now Uzbekistan).

h4. Trivia

The real life destroyer Tashkent had a top speed of 43 knots, technically making her faster than [[Shimakaze (destroyer)|]] but slower than the French destroyer [[Le Terrible (destroyer)|Le Terrible]]. With that in mind, she is currently the fastest destroyer implemented in game.

h4. See also

* [[Tashkent (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Tashkent (Pacific)]]
* [[Tashkent (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tashkent-class destroyer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tashkent-class_destroyer]
* "Kancolle Wiki: Tashkent":[http://en.kancollewiki.net/Tashkent]
* "Kancolle Wikia: Tashkent":[http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Tashkent]
other_names: タシュケント(艦隊これくしょん)

title: yuria_shardet
body:
Character of [[Endro!]]

Generally referred to as "Yuusha" (meaning hero but actually coming from her name), she insists that her class is "hero" even though such a thing only exists when there is a demon lord to slay.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] tied into [[low twintails]] with an [[ahoge]] and a [[hair flower|floral]] [[hairclip]].

Her upper body outfit consists of protection of her shoulders and neck, with upper body armour that resembles a [[breastplate]] on top but a pink babydoll underneath, and leaves her [[navel]] exposed, connected to her [[shoulder armor]] with a strap with a [[buckle]] on it on each side. She also wears [[brown gloves]].

Her lower body outfit consists primarily of a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] pinkish-[[red skirt]] with protective plates on the front, back and sides, with [[brown thighhighs]] underneath her [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots|knee-length]] [[armored boots]].

She wields a [[sword]] with a red blade as her weapon.

title: tsuruki_shizuka
body:
Shizuka Tsuruki is the leading main character from the [[Girls und Panzer]] spinoff, [[Girls und Panzer Ribbon no Musha|Girls und Panzer: Ribbon no Musha]]. 

Shizuka, [[Matsukaze Rin]], and [[Endou Haruka]] are students at Tatenashi High School. They represent the school in Tankathlon (a cousin of Tankery) under the banner of Team Centipede. Shizuka is not only the team's leader, but also serves as the commander, gunner, and loader of the team's sole vehicle, a red [[Type 97 Te-Ke|Type 97 Te-Ke tankette]].

She has [[tsurime|upward-angled]] [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] (or [[black hair|black]], depending on the artist). Her long bangs have been swept around in an unusual loop and kept in place with a [[large bow|large]] [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] tied into [[red bow|a]] [[hair bow|bow]], from which the series derives its name. She also has a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]]. Shizuka is most often found wearing either a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] or the full [[Tatenashi High School uniform]], along with [[loafers]] and [[brown pantyhose]]. However, she frequently slips off one of her shoes in battle "in order to non-verbally convey her directions to Rin":/posts/2227380.

On more than one occasion, she has gone into Tankathlon battles wearing a suit of classical [[Japanese armor]] and wielding a [[bow (weapon)|bow]].

Shizuka makes frequent use of the [[emblem]] of [[Takeda Shingen]]'s [[Centipede]] force, even to the point of making it her own team's emblem and decorating the Type 97 with the symbol.

Voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]] in the mobile game [[Girls und Panzer senshadou daisakusen!]].

title: yobou_banka
body:
Yobou Banka, also known by his moniker, the "Boy with goggles," is a minor character that is introduced in [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]]. An operative of Academy City's Dark Side organisation SCHOOL, he is the first member of the organization in their debut to be seen.

He has [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]] with [[sanpaku|small pupils and irises]]. He wears a ring-shaped [[headgear]] with [[electrodes]] as "goggles" around his forehead like a headband. His canonical character art features a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[shirt]], [[brown pants]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[sneakers]] for [[shoes]].

title: strip_game
body:
A party game where a group of people take turns playing and the loser at the end of each round has to [[undressing|strip]] as a penalty. Usually the game doesn't end until at least one player has lost enough clothing to be [[completely nude]].

It can also be the result of [[gambling]] where a person loses all their money and, in a desperate bid to win it back, starts literally betting the clothes off their back.

Specific types of strip games include [[strip poker]], [[strip mahjong]] and even [[rock paper scissors]].

Not to be confused with [[Twitter strip game]], a game played with the audience via votes.

h4. Examples

* !post #5565839

title: pie_chart
body:

title: bar_chart
body: A type of [[graph]] that represents data using bars of lengths proportional to the size of the data.

body:
[[Weapon]] from [[Splatoon (series)|]], debuting in [[Splatoon 3]]. It is a [[gun]] based off the [[super scope|Nintendo Super Scope.]]

title: radar_chart
body:
A [[graph]] that uses a shape to display something's strengths and weaknesses in multiple areas. Each corner of the shape represents a different area of evaluation, and the further the corner is from the center, the better the thing is in that aspect.

Also known as a spider chart, star plot, or Kiviat diagram.

h4. See also

* [[stats]]
* [[chart]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Radar chart":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radar_chart]

title: afro
body:
A hairstyle in which the curly hair extends out from the head in a roundish shape.

Often used for comical purposes - when a character is caught in an explosion, it results in their hair puffing out into an afro.

When it is huge, it should also be tagged [[huge afro]].

h4. See also

* [[Huge afro]]
* [[Afro puffs]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: yuki_miku_(2025)
body:
[i]Crystal Snow Ver.[/i]

The 2025 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest this year was キラキラスノーマテリアル (Glittering Snow Material). The winner of the contest was Candidate No.5 by [[Nekoneko (nekohoshi neko)|]]. The main visual was illustrated by [[tokki]].

This version of Yuki Miku has a [[crystal]] motif. She has a multitude of snow-themed [[hair ornament]]s, including a [[crystal hair ornament|crystal]], [[snowflake hair ornament|snowflake]], [[icicle]]s, and [[snowball]]s. She wears a [[blue dress]] and carries an icicle [[sceptre]]. She wears a [[single thighhigh|single]] white thighhigh. Her [[twintails]] end in [[low drills]].

[[Rabbit Yukine|Yukine]]'s design has a matching sceptre, snowball hair ornament, and [[vest]].

Her unofficial nickname is "Crystal-chan":[https://twitter.com/nekohoshi_neko/status/1824611088115306969] (クリスタルちゃん)

Her theme song is [b]Crystal Snow[/b] by Aqu3ra.

title: usugumo_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Usugumo[/i]. Character designed by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by Moriyama Yurika. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a ponytail (tied with a red ribbon similar to Murakumo's tress ribbons) with swept bangs and long sidelocks as well as light [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], blue [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. However, since the first official picture of her was without her uniform, some fans drew her with an outfit intermediary or similar to [[murakumo (kancolle)|Murakumo]]'s outfit due to being part of DesDiv 12 like Murakumo. She is unusual in the way she was first revealed: in the lead-up for the 2020 [[Lawson]] campaign (which would end up being delayed due to the [[coronavirus pandemic|COVID-19 pandemic]]), wearing the uniform. Her [[rigging]] is also similar to the other Special-Types: a funnel-mast backpack set, 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a 12.7 cm Type A twin gun mount [[handgun]]. h4. Appearance * !post #3972447: Base * !post #7643472: Tsuyu Mode * !post #4313454: [[Usugumo (Lawson) (Kancolle)|Lawson]] * !post #5686003: [[Usugumo (race queen) (kancolle)|Race Queen]] h4. [i]Fubuki[/i]-class destroyers * [[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]] * [[Shirayuki (Kancolle)|]] * [[Hatsuyuki (Kancolle)|]] * [[Miyuki (kancolle)|]] * [[Murakumo (Kancolle)|]] * Shinonome (Yet to be implemented) * [b]Usugumo[/b] * [[Shirakumo (Kancolle)|]] * [[Isonami (Kancolle)|]] * [[Uranami (Kancolle)|]] h4. title: mitsukoshi_(department_store)
body:
An international department store chain with headquarters in Tokyo.

Since its inception as a [[kimono]] store "[i]Echigoya[/i]", Mitsukoshi has been adopting innovative business methods, such as the world's first fixed-price cash sales, Japan's first "modern-style" department store, and "the collaboration with subculture":[http://mitsukoshi.mistore.jp/onlinestore/shops/kancolle/].

In April 2008, Mitsukoshi and [[Isetan_(department_store)|]] were merged and to form the Isetan Mitsukoshi group. Besides Japan, it currently has branches in Mainland China, Taiwan, and the Philippines. 

h4. External links

* "Nihombashi Mitsukoshi Main Store Official website":[https://cp.mistore.jp/global/en/nihombashi.html]
* "ISETAN MITSUKOSHI Official website":[https://cp.mistore.jp/global/en.html]

title: batsubyou
body:
An unofficial name of a [[white cat]] with a red circle on its belly in [[Kantai Collection]].

It appeared in the game's "server error" page with an [[Error Musume]]. Its name is a wordplay for "batsubyou" (抜錨, literally "to weigh anchor") and "byou" (another reading of 猫 / neko, a cat).

Now the developers of [[Kantai Collection]] officially call all bugs and errors in the game "cats".

title: spam_(food)
body:
A [[canned food|canned]] spiced [[ham]] made by the Hormel company since 1937. Competing and generic brands sell their products under the generic term "luncheon [[meat]]."

Due to its low price and ease of preservation, it was regularly issued as a field ration to soldiers around the world, particularly the [[United States Army]] during [[World War II]], the [[Korean War]], and the [[Vietnam War]]. The meat would often end up within the communities where American forces were stationed and was incorporated into local dishes.  Examples include Okinawan poku tamago (pork & eggs) dishes, Korean budae-jjigae (Army base stew), and Hawaiian Spam musubi.

The meat's abundance and its reputation of its low quality spawned a slang for quantity over quality.

h4. See also

* [[spam (messaging)]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spam (food)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spam_(food)]

title: film_grain
body:
A grainy, sand-like texture that appears in traditional film photography. Artists sometimes simulate film grain for artistic effect, especially to achieve a cinematic or [[retro artstyle|retro]] look.

This tag includes both traditional analog film grain and digital camera sensor noise.

h4. See also

* [[chromatic aberration]]
* [[heavy film grain]]
* [[lens flare]]

title: yuuki_(princess_connect!)
body:
The main character of [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. In the first game, he has no facial appearance, but in the second he does. He is a member of [[Gourmet Guild (princess connect!)|]] and a former member of [[Twinkle Wish (princess connect!)|]].

He has [[short hair]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]] & [[hair between eyes]], as well as [[blue eyes]] (sometimes depicted as [[green eyes|green]]). He is depicted wearing a [[necklace]], [[green shirt]], [[brown gloves]], [[blue cape]], [[brown pants]], [[belt]], a [[pauldrons|pauldron]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

He is voiced by [[Abe Atsushi]].

h4. External Links

title: gelatin
body:
A translucent and colorless powder derived from collagen inside animal skin and bones. It is added to water to firm it up and provide texture, and tends to jiggle if moved around.

This tag mostly refers to the jello [[dessert]], although it can also be used in cooking. Savory gelatin is referred to as aspic.

A similar food product derived from red algae is called [[agar]] jelly. It is commonly used in the Japanese dessert [[anmitsu (dessert)|]].

h4.See also

* [[konnyaku_(food)|konnyaku]]
* [[pudding]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: cross-laced_sweater
body: A [[sweater]] design that incorporates lace-up or crisscrossed ties as a prominent decorative (and sometimes functional) feature. These laces may appear down the front, back, or along the sides of the sweater, typically threaded through eyelets or loops so that the laces create an “X” pattern.

title: knit_sweater
body:
A type of garment made from interlocked loops of yarn that create a flexible, warm fabric. While the term “[[sweater]]” refers generally to a knitted or crocheted upper-body garment, in common usage, a “knit sweater” usually highlights the specific construction method—knitting, where yarn is worked together in rows of loops.

Knit sweaters can feature a variety of patterns such as [[cable knit]]s, [[ribbed sweater|ribbing]], [[Aran sweater|Aran designs]], Fair Isle colorwork, and more. They also come in many silhouettes—[[crew neck]], [[V-neck]], [[cardigan]], and [[turtleneck]], among others.

title: puyopuyo_fever
body:
The fifth installment in the [[Puyopuyo]] series, released as Puyo Pop Fever in the West. Introduced a brand new Fever mode, where players can make large, preset Puyo chains after filling an offset meter, and new patterns of three or four puyo instead of the traditional two. A entirely new universe and characters are also introduced in this game as well.

h4. Timeline

title: puyopuyo_20th_anniversary
body: A game in the [[Puyopuyo]] series. The story is a direct sequel to [[Puyopuyo 7]], and the game was released in 2011 for the Nintendo DS, 3DS, Wii, and PlayStation Portable. As of 2024, the game has never been officially released in English. h4. Timeline [[Puyopuyo 7|<]] (2009) [[Puyopuyo 7]] | [[Puyopuyo Quest]] (2013) [[Puyopuyo Quest|>]] h4. Characters While no additional characters debuted in this game, some [[official alternate costume|new costumes]] were released, and [[Ecolo (puyopuyo)|]] gained a human form. * !asset #22961827: [[Unusual Ecolo]] * !post #1446535: [[Black Sig]] * !asset #22961843: [[Red Amitie]] ([[official alternate costume|Character skin]]) * !asset #22961862: [[White Feli]] ([[official alternate costume|Character skin]]) * !asset #22961875: [[Yellow Satan (puyopuyo)|]] ([[official alternate costume|Character skin]]) h4. Trivia * This game marks a noticeable change in art style for the series, sometimes dubbed by Japanese fans as "20th Style" ("20th風":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/20th%E9%A2%A8]). Style changes include: Wider heads, eyes without pupils, color highlights, and shaded character sprites (as it was only [[flat color]] in the prior [[Puyopuyo 7]] and [[puyopuyo fever|Fever]] games).

title: puyopuyo_tetris
body: A crossover game between the [[Puyopuyo]] and [[Tetris]] franchises developed by [[Sega]]. Released in 2014 (and rereleased for the Switch and international markets in 2017), the game allows players to compete against each other using play styles from both series, and also introduces Big Bang mode to the greater Puyopuyo franchise. h4. Timeline [[Puyopuyo Quest|<]] (2013) [[Puyopuyo Quest]] | [[Puyopuyo Tetris 2]] (2020) [[Puyopuyo Tetris 2|>]] h4. title: guntou
body:
A [[Japan]]ese mass produced [[military]] ceremonial [[sword]] produced for the Imperial Japanese army and navy after the introduction of conscription in 1872. They were distributed to [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] and [[Imperial Japanese Army]] [[officer]]s as it was required that officers wear a sword.

There were two types of guntou, the kyuu guntou (old military sword) and shin guntou (new military sword).  The kyuu guntou were used from 1875 until 1934.  Their production was not standardized, with different craftsmen producing them.  Many styles closely resembled European and American [[saber_(weapon)|sabres]] of the time.  The shin guntou were used from 1935 until 1945.  Most of these were produced in the Toyokawa Naval Arsenal and were based on traditional slung [[tachi_(weapon)|]] of the Kamakura Period (1185–1332).

These swords were used during the [[Russo-Japanese War]], [[World War I]], and [[World War II]]. Most notoriously as a last resort weapon used in the [i]banzai[/i] charge tactic.

Also known as a “PB&J”.

title: sega_32x
body:
The [b]Sega 32X[/b] is an add-on for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[video game]] console. It was distributed under the name [b]Super 32X[/b] (スーパー32X [i]Sūpā Sātī Tsu Ekkusu[/i]) in Japan, [b]Sega Genesis 32X[/b] in North America, [b]Sega Mega Drive 32X[/b] in the PAL region, and [b]Sega Mega 32X[/b] in Brazil.

The 32X was designed to expand the power of the Mega Drive and serve as a holdover until the release of the [[Sega Saturn]]. Independent of the Mega Drive, the 32X utilizes its own ROM cartridges and had its own library of games. 

Unveiled at June 1994's Consumer Electronics Show, Sega presented the 32X as the "poor man's entry into 'next generation' games...". The product was originally conceived as an entirely new console by [[Sega]] of Japan and positioned as an inexpensive alternative for gamers into the fifth generation of game consoles, but at the suggestion of Sega of America, the console was converted into an add-on to the existing Mega Drive and made more powerful, with two 32-bit central processing unit chips and a 3D graphics processor. 

Despite these changes, the console failed to attract either developers or consumers as the Sega Saturn had already been announced for release the following year. In part because of this, and also to rush the 32X to market before the holiday season in 1994, the 32X suffered from a weak library of titles. With sales only reaching as high as 665,000 units, the 32X is still considered a commercial failure.

title: yu-gi-oh!_ocg_structures
body:
Japanese name: 遊☆戯☆王 ＯＣＧストラクチャーズ
English romanization: [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] official card game Sutorakuchāzu

Yu-Gi-Oh! OCG Structures is a manga series. It is set in a real-world Tokyo, Japan. The manga began serialization on June 21, 2019, in the V Jump magazine. The manga is authored by [[sato masashi|Masashi Satō]], who previously did the artwork for the [[yu-gi-oh!_5d's|Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]] manga.
Unlike previous manga spin-offs, OCG Structures manga does not have an anime counterpart; however, characters from the Japan-only Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters Saikyo Card Battle make appearances. 

The manga is based around the real-world OCG rules, as well as set releases. No new card types are introduced, but due to the nature of the manga, any previous type can be the focus of the chapter, based on the Deck the Duelists have built. 

The series follows [[yusa_shoma|Shoma Yusa]], who moved to a big city from the deep countryside at the invitation of his older sister.

h4. External links
* "Yu-Gi-Oh! Wiki: OCG Structures":[https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Yu-Gi-Oh!_OCG_Structures]

title: kamen_rider_den-o
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_den-o_(series)|Kamen Rider Den-O]], seventeenth show in the Kamen Rider series and eighth of the Heisei generation.

Nogami Ryotaro is an extremely unlucky young man who happens to be a "Singularity Point" - he can exist outside his "home timeline" and be immune to permanent possession by Imagin, monsters who seek to alter history in their favor by offering a "contract" with discontented people. Having won the allegiance of 4 (later 5) Imagin, he transforms into Den-O.

Besides the basic Plat Form, Den-O can change his aura armor depending on which Imagin is in possession, altering his style: Sword Form with hot-headed [[Momotaros]] (red, default), Rod Form with smooth-talking [[Urataros]] (blue), Axe Form with boisterous [[Kintaros]] (yellow), Gun Form with cheerful [[Ryutaros]] (violet), and (to a lesser extent) Wing Form with princely [[Sieg]] (white). He later earns two fusion forms: Climax and Liner Forms.

title: goth_fashion
body:
A fashion style that is typically dark, sometimes morbid, with elements borrowed from Elizabethan and Victorian fashion. Goth fashion can be recognized by its stark black clothing (or hair or makeup), often contrasted with boldly colored clothing, hair and makeup in shades of deep reds, purples, blues or emerald green, lace, silks, and high heels for either gender. 

On Danbooru, the [[goth fashion]] tag refers to both western and eastern styles of gothic clothing.

title: has_bad_revision
body:
A post with a [[revision]] at the source that is bad, and should not be uploaded.

There's a number of more specific tags that can also be used:

* [[has artifacted revision]]
* [[has cropped revision]]
* [[has censored revision]]
* [[has downscaled revision]]
* [[has lossy revision]]
* [[has watermarked revision]]
* [[has adversarial noise revision]]

Note that this tag is supposed to be used on image that are already tagged with [[md5 mismatch]], [i]not[/i] on revisions that are actually already uploaded. Images that use this tag should also have some amount of visual identity or sameness to the revision at source, and this should not be tagged on images that have actual revisions even if they are smaller resolution (post #2561932, post #2749109) or deficient in other respects. In other words, the deficiency should be the [i]only[/i] change between the image on Danbooru and the revision at the source.

See [[md5 mismatch]] for more information on uploading revisions.

h4. See also

* [[image sample]]

title: lumine_(genshin_impact)
body:
One of the two possible protagonists in [[Genshin Impact]], and the [[twins|twin]] [[brother and sister|sister]] of [[Aether (Genshin Impact)|]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long locks]] and [[hair flower]]s. She wears a [[white dress|white]], [[high-low dress|high-low]] [[halter dress]] with a [[white overskirt|white]] [[overskirt]], a [[collared cape]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]].

Her English-localized name is [b]Lumine[/b], [b]Yíng[/b] (荧, meaning "luminous") in Chinese and [b]Hotaru[/b] (蛍, meaning "firefly") in Japanese. In Teyvat, her true name is only used by her brother. As a result, she is often paired with [[Firefly (honkai: star rail)|]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]], whose name is also localized as "Hotaru" in Japanese

If chosen as the player character, she is referred to in-game by the name set by the player or as [b]Traveler[/b] by most people in Teyvat. If not chosen as the player character, she is instead the [spoiler]leader of the Abyss Order[/spoiler].

Voiced by [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese).

title: honglan_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Park Ji-yoon]] (Korean) | [[Yukana]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A dragon girl who's usually seen playing around with either clouds or her pet rabbits. She may appear like an airheaded eccentric at first glance, she is one of the Four Guardians of Gaon, a group comprised of four formidable Souls each guarding the north, south, east, and west territories of Gaon from external threats. She has domain over ice and can employ the help of an ice dragon during her battles.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Green Dragon Crescent Blade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Dragon_Crescent_Blade][/i].

title: viet_cong
body:
Known in the Western world by the name "Viet Cong" (meaning "Red Vietnamese"), the [b]National Liberation Front[/b] was a [[communism|communist]] revolutionary organization that operated in South Vietnam and Cambodia after the post-colonial division of Vietnam in December 1960. During the [[Vietnam War]], the NLF was a [[guerilla]] movement that fought primarily in the southern provinces of South Vietnam against the forces of the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] and their international allies.

Although the NLF was officially disbanded in 1977 after Vietnam was successfully reunified, the organization had functionally ceased to exist after suffering catastrophic losses during the failed 1968 Tet Offensive. Although North Vietnam would continue to pay lip service to their southern comrades during the remainder of the conflict (even flying [[Viet Cong flag]]s from their tanks as they entered Saigon), practically speaking the remainder of the conflict would be a conventional war, waged by the [[People's Army of Vietnam]] with what remained of the NLF providing logistical support. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viet_Cong]
other_names: 南ベトナム解放民族戦線

body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Yang Jeong-hwa (Korean)
[hr]
Crown Princess of the Tabrian Empire, a militaristic nation ruled by the Great Empress Brigid and the ethos of "might makes right." She is a formidable commander in battle, leading her troops in such a calculated fashion, as if she was a conductor in an orchestra. She also has trouble expressing her emotions, especially towards those she holds dearly like her sister [[Edith_(eversoul)|]], as well as a very weak tolerance to cheese and alcohol.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Astrape":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astrape_and_Bronte][/i].

title: haru_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Gwak Gyu-mi (Korean) | [[Koyama Momoyo]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A fox girl working as a Forest Keeper for the Fayren Union. She was raised by two Soul Animals, a female "summer fox" and a male "winter wolf", in an unnamed snowy mountain until their recent passing due to Mana exhaustion, prompting her move to Fayren. Generally introverted and unsociable due to her battle style as a stealth-focused fighter. While she does say she can handle being alone for long periods of time, she does enjoy others' company, even if she doesn't physically show it.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Kutune Shirka":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kutune_Shirka][/i].

title: garnet_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Ga-ryung (Korean) | Kanno Mai (Japanese)
[hr]
A childish hopeless romantic at first glance, this hides her true identity of being a high-ranking member of Duchess [[Sigrid_(eversoul)|]]'s Nightbloods, an elite task force that enforces Sigrid's "rules" onto the lawless Tabrian underground Night City. A classic [[yandere]] character, she falls for the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]] at first sight and is very possessive of him, with her willingness to murder her "competition" being one of his main concerns about her.

Her associated artifact is the [i]"Spear of Longinus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_Lance[/i].

title: child
body:
This tag is for images containing children of either sex.

Use [[petite]] when the character is short but displays more developed physical attributes (e.g. wider hips for girls, wider shoulders for boys).

If the image is [[howto:rate|sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]], use the [[loli]] or [[shota]] tags as appropriate (which are mutually exclusive with this tag).

Not to be confused with [[aged down]], which is for when a character is portrayed as younger than their usual age.

[tn][b]If you are not sure whether a post should be tagged as child or loli/shota, ask in the "loli / shota check thread":[/forum/show/33650].[/b][/tn]

h4. Related Tags

* [[flat chest]]
* [[small breasts]]
* [[flat ass]]
* [[baby]]

title: flynn_(eversoul)
body:
A Beast-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Jang Mi (Korean) | [[Shintani Mayumi]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A genius but reckless hyena-like pyromaniac from the Republic of Chalar. Usually seen in her disheveled look, she's always spotted with an explosion or two nearby, earning her the ire of the general populace, not like she really cares about her reputation. Her dream is to create the greatest explosion the world has ever seen, a massive escalation of her initial dream of [spoiler]creating the most explosive fireworks the world has ever seen until she realized people don't really care all that much about "harmless" fireworks anyway, sowing seeds of insecurity and desire to be validated by someone[/spoiler].

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"RPG-7":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RPG-7][/i].

title: bullet_man
body:
A series of metallic statues resembling helmeted, nude men, displayed in front of the Alpensia Ski Jumping Center in Pyeongchang, South Korea. The statues reached memetic status in Japan during the 2018 [[Olympics]], where a broadcast featured them as an establishing shot of the center.

The Japanese net quickly warmed up to them, giving them the nickname "Morugessoyo" (モルゲッソヨ; a transliterated version of [i]moreugesseoyo[/i], Korean for "I don't know"), and were also later used as a materials for the [[petrification]] works.

title: calvin_klein
body:
An [[underwear]] and [[sports bra]] brand primarily focused on women. Calvin Klein underwear can be distinguished by it being usually black, white, or grey in color, while the rim edge sports the [[Underwear writing|brand name]] on it.

The underwear is often associated with an athlethic woman character, and has surged in popularity due to a series of [[Street Fighter 6]] mods featuring the female casts wearing Calvin Klein underwear.

title: tonikaku_kawaii
body:
[b]Tonikaku Kawaii: Fly me to the moon[/b], also know as [b]Tonikawa[/b], is a [i]Weekly Shounen Sunday[/i] manga series by [[Hata Kenjirou]].

[[Yuzaki Nasa]] is a hard-working man with a bizarre name who strives to be remembered for something more. After getting hit by a truck, he meets Tsukuyomi Tsukasa and falls in love with her. He tries to get her on a date. She accepts his proposal on one condition: marriage. He agreed. A few years later, she confronts him at his apartment to fulfill their promise...

title: coughing
body:
A reflex to clear the windpipe, usually caused by respiratory infections or diseases. Differs from [[sneezing]] in that it usually repeats many times and aims to clear the windpipe of fluid and blockages rather than "to scratch an itch."

title: palpatine
body:
The ultimate [[Sith]] Master, [b]Sheev Palpatine[/b], also known as [b]Darth Sidious[/b] is the overarching antagonist of the [[Star Wars]] saga. 

The sinister Emperor of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], Palpatine is truly powerful in the Dark Side of the Force, a very cunning manipulator, utterly treacherous to those he deals with, and very cruel and merciless even to his own underlings.

Sith Master of [[Darth Vader]].

title: reuniclus
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #579 in the National PokéDex.
Reuniclus is a pale green Pokémon surrounded by a blob of translucent, green gelatinous substance. It has a large, round head with a thin stripe down the center. Its eyes are black and oval, while its mouth is red and triangular. Its body is small with stubby arms and legs. However, there are several round objects floating next to its arms. These objects increase in size and darken in color the further they are from the body and form arm-like appendages. The gel around these appendages forms three-fingered hands. 

It evolves from [[Duosion]].

Type: Psychic
Abilities: Overcoat / Magic Guard (Hidden: Regenerator)
Height: 100 cm / 3'3"
Weight: 20.1 kg / 44.3 lbs

Japanese Name: [b]Lanculus[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Duosion]]
Next Pokémon: [[Ducklett]]

title: uzuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Uzuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink_hair|pink hair]] with [[antenna hair]], and [[pink_eyes|pink]]/[[red_eyes|red eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent hair ornament|crescent]] and [[rabbit hair ornament]]s, [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with white stripes, and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back (with [[cherry blossoms]] attached), a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

Do not use if the entire bra is fully or mostly visible, or if the character is only wearing a bra on their torso.

title: aurebesh
body:
A fictional writing system from the [[Star Wars]] franchise.

[b]Aurebesh[/b] was a writing system commonly used to represent the Basic language used across the known [[galaxy]] in the Star Wars saga. The name came from a combination of the first two letters, Aurek and Besh. 

Aurebesh implemented consonants, vowels, digraphs, and punctuation marks. Words were separated by spaces. Aurebesh could be written mainly left-to-right or up-to-down. All letters are the same relative size, although occasionally symbols were mirror-inverted to denote capital letters. The symbol for the Republic Credit was a Resh (R for Republic) with two vertical lines through the upper half of the symbol. Letters of the alphabet were also used to denote musical keys, such as the key of Cresh.

title: jesus
body:
Central figure of Christianity, believed to be part of the Holy Trinity ([[yahweh|Father]], Son, and Holy Ghost). Adherents of Christianity believe Jesus was the 'begotten Son of [[yahweh|God]]' who was made incarnate of the [[Virgin Mary]], became man, [[crucifixion|sacrificed himself on the cross]] to 'cleanse' mankind of its sins, resurrected from the dead after three days, and ascended into Heaven.

Islam, a kindred religion of Abrahamic roots, reveres him as a messenger and as the Messiah, but not as the Son of God. 

Some Mormons (a nontrinitarian restorationist sect) even believe that the ancient [[Aztec]] god [[Quetzalcoatl (mythology)|]] was historically [b]Jesus Christ[/b], who visited America in ancient times.

Certain anime and manga series occasionally add their own interpretations of Jesus. One such example closest to [[the Bible]] is [[Steel Ball Run]], but mostly based on Mormon interpretations.

Christ is a title meaning "messiah", not his surname.

When needed specificity he can be refered as "Jesus of Nazareth", named after his hometown.

h4. Famous depictions of Jesus

* !asset #24783018: [[The Last Supper]]
* !asset #24783003: [[Lost Lamb]]
* !asset #23438446: [[He Lives (simon dewey)|]]
* !asset #24783036: [[Potato Jesus (meme)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Ecce Homo]]

title: yosuga_no_sora
body:
[b]Yosuga no Sora[/b] is a bishoujo eroge game by Sphere, first released in 2008. Known as "Yosusora" for short. Illustrated by [[Hashimoto Takashi]] and [[Suzuhira Hiro]]. The franchise also includes a 2010 manga and a 2010 softcore TV anime.

(In)famous for setting up the precedent of the [[siscon]]-[[brocon]] anime trope that later became something of a norm (though much toned down in mainstream media compared to the series' outright [[incest]]ous themes).

h4. Characters

h6. Main characters

* [[Amatsume Akira]]
* [[Kasugano Haruka]] (the male protagonist)
* [[Kasugano Sora]]
* [[Migiwa Kazuha]]
* [[Nogisaka Motoka]]
* [[Yorihime Nao]]

h6. Supporting characters

* [[Ifukube Yahiro]]
* [[Kuranaga Kozue]]
* [[Nakazato Ryouhei]]

h4. See also

title: yosuga_no_sora_door_scene_(meme)
body:
[[Parody]] of an infamous scene from [[Yosuga no Sora]].

The scene involves the [[incest]]ous brother [[Kasugano Haruka]] and his sister [[Kasugano Sora|Sora]] having [[doggystyle]] [[sex]] in front of their house's doorway, before getting [[caught]] by Haruka's friends who [[walk-in]] to their house.

title: nagatsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Nagatsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent hair ornament]], [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and a [[depth charge]] to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles.

title: kamen_rider_birth
body:
Secondary Rider of [[kamen_rider_ooo_(series)|Kamen Rider OOO]].

[[date_akira|Date Akira]] is a world traveler who, upon returning to Japan in order to fund his next adventure, was hired by the Kougami Foundation to become the first wielder of their Birth Driver.
Unlike [[kamen_rider_ooo|OOO]] who uses Core Medals, Birth transforms by way of the expendable but very common Cell Medals, which also double as ammo for his Birth Buster or "payment" for Birth CLAWs, an armament system contained within [[gashapon]]-like Receptacle Orbs located throughout his armor. Later in the series Akira leaves Japan, and during this period [[gotou_shintarou|Gotou Shintarou]] takes over as Kamen Rider Birth.

title: about:userscripts
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
1. "Intro":#dtext-intro
2. "Bookmarklets":#dtext-bookmarklets
3. "Scripts":#dtext-scripts
4. "How to use":#dtext-how-to-use
5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

h4#intro. Intro

Various userscripts exist to improve your experience using Danbooru and related sites.

h4#bookmarklets. Bookmarklets

* "Post/Batch to Danbooru":[/static/bookmarklet] - Automagically populates the image, source, artist and tags for various image source sites. See topic #14119 for the full list of support.
* "Goto Pixiv/Twitter/Nicoseiga/Deviantart/Pawoo/Nijie":[/forum_posts/132578] - Go directly to a post using only the post ID.
* "Enable/Disable Embedded Notes":[/forum_posts/136193] - Provides the ability to change the embedded mode of notes used on a post.  With embedded notes enabled, the text becomes visible without needing to hover over the text box. See topic #11337.
* "Clean Post URLs":[/forum_posts/136251]: Removes trailing search parameters on image links from the post search page so that maintaining bookmarks is easier.
* "Switch Danbooru domain":[/forum_posts/142450]: Provides a mechanism to quickly switch between Danbooru's subdomains.
* "Switch safe mode":[/forum_posts/220485]: Switches the safe mode on or off.
* "Set color theme":[/forum_posts/220485]: Sets the color theme at auto, light, or dark.
** "Updated color theme switcher":[/forum_posts/232433]: Isn't separated, but doesn't do auto.

[tn][b]Note:[/b]  Bookmarklets are normally disabled on certain sites like Twitter using the Firefox web browser.  In order to use any of the above bookmarklets from those sites, install and use the Firefox addon "Bookmarklets Context Menu":[https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/bookmarklets-context-menu/].[/tn]

h4#scripts. Scripts

h5. Danbooru

h6. User interface

* "Miscellaneous Tweaks":[https://sleazyfork.org/scripts/3467] - Adds an assortment of mostly-independent tweaks to Danbooru.  Settings are changed by clicking the "Tweaks" link inserted into the navbar.
* "Danbooru 2 Tweaks":http://userscripts-mirror.org/scripts/show/160157 - Another script with assorted changes.  Settings are changed by modifying the top of the script.
* "Danbooru 2 Tweaks & Features":https://github.com/Lightforger/danbooru-userscript/ - See topic #9023
* "Danbooru EX":[/forum_topics/13167]: Adds a variety of tweaks and new features. See https://github.com/evazion/danbooru-ex for an overview.
* "Better Better Booru":[https://github.com/pseudonymous/better-better-booru]: Various tweaks to make Danbooru better.
* "Danbooru FOF":[https://github.com/reiyasona/danbooru.user.js] ("install":[https://github.com/reiyasona/danbooru.user.js/raw/master/scripts/danbooru_fof/danbooru_fof.user.js]): User script that slightly fades out your favourites.
* "DTextStyler":[/forum_topics/14229]:  Adds controls to the top of the textbox that assists with the [[help:dtext|DText]] style markup Danbooru uses.
* "SiteTagSearches":[/forum_topics/14958]:  Adds many more site links beyond the standard Pixiv links on wiki page entries.  For tag links, it has [b]Gelbooru[/b], [b]Yandere[/b], [b]Sankaku[/b], and [b]Konachan[/b].  For other links ([tn]which includes other languages like Japanese[/tn]), it has [b]Pixiv[/b], [b]Nicoseiga[/b], [b]Nijie[/b], [b]Tinami[/b], [b]BCY.net[/b], [b]Deviantart[/b], [b]Artstation[/b], [b]Tumblr[/b], [b]Twitter[/b], and [b]E-Hentai[/b].
* "EventListener":[/forum_topics/14747]:  Checks frequently for new events of interest. This includes [b]flags[/b], [b]appeals[/b], new [b]dmails[/b] or [b]spam[/b], [b]comments[/b], [b]notes[/b], [b]artist commentaries[/b], [b]post edits[/b], [b]post approvals[/b], [b]pools[/b], [b]wiki pages[/b], [b]forum posts[/b], [b]bans[/b], [b]user feedback[/b], [b]mod actions[/b].
* "CurrentUploads":[/forum_topics/15169]:  Checks the upload count from the last 24 hours for any user plus the copyrights they've uploaded, and offers statistics and various other time periods for comparison. This helps with upload pacing and variety.
* "DisplayPostInfo":[/forum_topics/15926]: Displays the uploader, top tagger, and post views on a post.
* "Safelist Plus":[/forum_topics/14221]: Alternate blacklist handler, with changing between multiple blacklists supported. Also has a mechanism to change CSS styles, which can be used with a blacklist or standalone.
* "TranslatorAssist":[/forum_topics/20687]: User interface to assist a translator on Danbooru. Also includes background functions to check for recent/new noters on a post.
* "Wiki Card":[/forum_topics/8502?page=7#forum_post_241589]: Adds a wiki viewer to the uploading and tag editing forms.
* "Panzoom":[/forum_posts/236266]: Adds image pan and zoom to the upload page and media asset page.

h6. Functional

* "Unlimited Paginator Works":[https://sleazyfork.org/scripts/5250] - Loads subsequent pages of various searches on various *boorus as you scroll down.  It supports six sites by default and is supposed to work pretty well on similar sites after you add them to the includes list.
* "Note assist":https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Lightforger/Note-Assist/master/Note-Assist.user.js - Userscript designed to make translating easier and faster by automatically resizing or creating the notes for you.  See that page or topic #9373 for more information.
* "ValidateTagInput":[/forum_topics/14474]: Checks all tag adds and removals on uploads or post edits, and warns the user about adding nonexistent tags or being unable to remove a tag due to an implication.
* "IndexedAutocomplete":[/forum_topics/14701]:  On average increases the speed of autocomplete by using an alternate storage mechanism.  It also adds additional autocomplete in various places where it currently enabled.
* "RecentTagsCalc":[/forum_topics/15851]: Replaces the existing recent tags when editing/uploading a post with using alternate schemes of collecting and displaying recently used tags.
* "Refined Danbooru":[https://github.com/kidonng/cherry/tree/main/scripts#refined-danbooru] - more keyboard shortcuts, add toggles for tag groups and more.
* "Blacklist2":[/forum_posts/255401]: Adds full search query support and partial metatag support to blacklists.
* "Hide Uploads":[https://files.catbox.moe/nk1fbv.js]: Allows hiding posts from the "My Uploads" tab. Toggling "Show hidden" will reveal hidden items.
* "Danbooru tag input remapper":[https://gist.githubusercontent.com/HyphenSam/bd1ed0924fe1f95d5fad5fcfac997b0f/raw/687c06727df75cfc7911cd88d237a4cda41fd5cb/Danbooru_tag_input_remapper.js]: Allows for remapping of keyboard inputs when tagging.

h5. External sites

* "Cleared Pixiv Artists":[https://sleazyfork.org/en/scripts/3634] - Lets you keep track of pixiv artists you intend to look over later and get randomly sent to one of them. 
* "Pixiv Translation Plus":http://userscripts-mirror.org/scripts/show/65644 - Translates the Pixiv interface and some tags.  You have the ability to add your own custom translations (which override the defaults).
* "Pixiv Image Searches and Stuff (PISAS)":https://github.com/nottalulah/userscripts/raw/master/Pixiv_Image_Searches_and_Stuff.user.js - Searches Danbooru for pixiv IDs, adds IQDB links, and filters thumbs based on number of favorites (first two are disabled by default).
* "Pixiv Infinite Scroll/Animation Download Links":https://greasyfork.org/scripts/3091 - Infinite scroll + Inline image/manga expansion + Animation .zip download links (including timing information for animation frames)
* "Pixiv Direct Links":https://greasyfork.org/scripts/4555 - Turns thumbnail titles into direct or mode=manga links, adds direct image links on mode=manga pages, replaces the medium thumbnail on mode=medium pages with the full size, and disables lazy-loading images. 
* "Translate Pixiv Tags":[/forum_topics/14673]: Translates tags on [b]Pixiv[/b], [b]Nijie[/b], [b]NicoSeiga[/b], [b]Tinami[/b], and [b]BCY[/b] to [b]Danbooru[/b] tags. Additionally it looks up the tag used for an artist.
* "IQDBBooru":[/forum_topics/14450]:  Adds a link when a tag search is performed, which when clicked will check every thumbnail against Danbooru's IQDB database and highlights hits and misses.  Currently supports [b]Gelbooru[/b], [b]Yandere[/b], [b]Konachan[/b], [b]Sankaku[/b].
* "IQDB4chan":[/forum_topics/14420]:  Adds a link on the threads of image boards, which when clicked will check every thumbnail against Danbooru's IQDB database and highlights hits and misses.
* "New Twitter Image Searches and Stuff":[/forum_topics/16342] (NTISAS):   Based off the same concept as PISAS, it helps identify already uploaded images on Twitter, and provides a mechanism for highlighting and filtering tweets based upon the favorite score, along with several other user interface enhancements.

h4#how-to-use. How to use

h5. Bookmarklets

1. Right-click on bookmarks bar
2a. (Chrome) Add page
2b. (Firefox) Add bookmark
3. Add description to [b]Name[/b] field
4. Copy bookmarklet text and add to the [b]URL[/b] field

To activate the bookmarklet, just click the bookmark link.

h5. Scripts

1. Install a userscript extension
** https://tampermonkey.net
** https://violentmonkey.github.io
2. Click userscript install link
** Should end with the [code]user.js[/code] file extension
3. At the prompt, click install

If you don't get a prompt, try the additional following steps.

4. Open userscript manager dashboard by left clicking the icon in the bar
5. Click the + icon to create a new script
6. Copy/paste the userscript text into the text area
7. Save the script using the controls at the top of the text area or by using Ctrl + S

Once the script is saved, it will automatically activate on the pages it is allowed to run on. Sometimes there are issues with it loading after the initial install, which are usually resolved by restarting the browser.

h4#see-also. See also

* topic #8502 (general discussion)

h4#external-links. External links

* [b]Scripts[/b]
** http://wiki.greasespot.net/User_script
* [b]Script managers[/b]
** https://tampermonkey.net
** https://violentmonkey.github.io

title: helldivers_(series)
body:
A [[science fiction]] shooting [[video game]] series developed by Arrowhead Game Studios. Set in a futuristic earth dubbed "Super Earth" where the player is part of the titular Helldivers [[space marine]]s who spread DEMOCRACY AND FREEDOM while beating up aliens and other undesirables. In reality, the government of Super Earth is actually an Authoritarian Fascist  Empire of conquest that doesn't practice democracy but a fake one called "Managed Democracy", which they brainwashed their citizens through indoctrination, propaganda and harsh laws against anyone that dare questions the state. 

A unique feature of the game is the "galactic campaign" is coordinated by every player's progress, regardless if they go solo or in a squad. Also friendly fire.

h5. Factions / characters

title: tententengokujigokugoku_(aiobahn)

title: gear_third
body:
One of [[Monkey D. Luffy]]'s transformations from [[One Piece]].

Luffy corks his mouth with his thumb, bites into his thumb joint (making a small opening) and blows very hard into it, which inflates his arm. He is then able to transfer the air through his entire body, requiring the torso to act as an interface for his various limbs. Luffy blows so much air into his body that when they are all focused on a single limb, they become the size equivalent to (or greater than) that of a giant's, if anything resembling [[oars_(one_piece)|Oars']] size.

title: gear_second
body:
One of [[Monkey D. Luffy]]'s transformations from [[One Piece]].

Luffy activates it by using his legs as a pump to expand his blood vessels, which allows oxygen to get to his muscles much faster. When this happens, the blood flowing rapidly through his body creates friction, heating up his body and makes his skin glow and produce steam. This increases his attack power and overall speed, but drains his stamina and if overused makes him temporarily unable to move afterward, as well as shortening his life span.

title: candy
body:
Candy, specifically sugar candy, is a confection made from a concentrated solution of sugar in water, to which flavorings and colorants are added. Candies come in numerous colors and varieties and have a long history in popular culture. Outside the United States, it is referred to as "sweets" or "confectioneries."

For the [[Smile Precure!]] character, see [[Candy (Smile Precure!)]].

title: jawbreakers
body: Also known as gobstopper. A type of large, hard spherical [[candy]] made out of multiple layer of sugar. It gained its name in the US and Canada for its extremely hard shell, which may results into dental damage if one were to bit it.

title: persona_3
body:
A Playstation 2 roleplaying game made by Atlus. Part of the [[Persona]] series.

In 2010 it was re-released on the Playstation Portable with a selectable female protagonist ([[Shiomi Kotone]]), and two new supporting characters, [[Iwasaki Rio]] and [[Hasegawa Saori]].

Part of the cast of Persona 3 also made an appearance as playable characters in [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena]].

It has received a remake called [[Persona 3 Reload]].

title: honzuki_no_gekokujou
body:
[[Honzuki no Gekokujou]] is an isekai fantasy series. The main protagonist is a hopeless book lover who unexpectedly dies and gets reincarnated in a fantasy world as a young girl named [[Myne (honzuki no gekokujou)|Myne]]. The only problem is that there are no books! And thus begins her relentless efforts to reinvent books in that world and spread the joy of reading to those around her!

The series started as a web novel by Kazuki Miya and was later published as a regular light novel. The novel itself is completed, but there is both a manga serialization and an anime adaption which are both ongoing.

title: madougushi_dahlia_wa_utsumukanai
body:
[i]Madougushi Dahlia wa Utsumukanai: Kyou kara Jiyuu na Shokunin Raifu[/i] (魔導具師ダリヤはうつむかない ～今日から自由な職人ライフ～) is a 2018-to-Present romance isekai light novel series by Amagishi Hisaya and illustrated by Kei.  It has been adapted into two manga adaptations and an anime adaptation has been announced in the works.  The series has two official English titles with the light novel titled [i]Dahlia in Bloom: Crafting a Fresh Start with Magical Tools[/i], or simply [i]Dahlia in Bloom[/i], and the second manga titled [i]Magic Artisan Dahlia Wilts No More[/i].

The story follows the female protagonist Dahlia Rossetti, a magical toolmaker who has just recently befallen unfortunate events.  Her father, a famous magical toolmaker, just recently passed away and shortly before she was to move in with her fiancée, he informs her he wishes to annul their engagement as he has fallen in love with another woman.  As their engagement had been arranged by their deceased fathers' and was not out of romantic feelings, she agrees though still feels betrayed. She had done a lot to conform to her fiancée's wishes of an ideal woman and thought time together would bridge their feelings.  Wanting to move on, she vows against future romance and to instead focus on crafting tools; a long cherished dream that she held even from her previous life in Japan.  During one of her outings to collect crafting materials she happens to meet an injured knight and their meeting would greatly change her life.

h4. Characters

* [[Dahlia Rossetti]]
* [[Wolfred Scalfarotto]]

title: matikanefukukitaru_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

The fortune-telling horse girl with a really long name (and meant to be read as [i]Machikane Fukukitaru[/i]), Matikanefukukitaru is obsessed about fortune and luck and collects a wild range of lucky charms. The other horse girls (and humans at times) often consult her with their luck as well. She often refers to a "Shiraoki-sama" as if they were a shinto deity (and indeed, a horse named Shiraoki is the RL horse's 5th generation mare line ancestor).

Her name, when read as a whole, roughly means "Good fortune comes to those who wait".

Her real life counterpart also has the same long name. This is originally intended to be "Machikane Fukukitaru", but later shortened to "Matikanefukukitaru" because of a maximum 18 letter limit on the international rules for racehorse names. Here, Machikane/Matikane is a [i]kanmei[/i] and many of the owner's horses have limit-filling names like these (See [[Matikane Tannhauser (Umamusume)|]] as well).

h4. Appearance

body:

She is also considered a big sister figure among younger [[horse girl|horse girls]] because of her life. However, despite all her traveling, she actually doesn't speak English. She mitigates this comfortably by using body language.

title: haru_urara_(umamusume)
body:
[i][[Umamusume]][/i] character. A very cheerful and friendly [[horse girl]] who never gives up. She is from Kochi, in Shikoku (the original horse's career was entirely spent racing in local races in Kochi).

Her real life counterpart is known not for winning (or even for having the longest losing streak, for that matter), but rather for her persistence in the face of a very long string of consecutive losses (no victories in [b][i]113[/i][/b] races); she was profiled in a 2016 short film, "The Shining Star of Losers Everywhere":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5424802].

title: kamen_rider_meteor
body:
Secondary Rider of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (series)|Kamen Rider Fourze]].

His real name is [[Sakuta Ryuusei|Sakuta Ryusei]], a member of the Anti-Zodiarts Union who also doubles as the rival and eventual friend of [[Kisaragi Gentarou|Kisaragi Gentaro]] and [[Kamen Rider Fourze]].

Unlike Fourze, his powers come from the M-BUS [[satellite]] [[space station]] in Earth's orbit above Japan, which holds necessary energy for Meteor to transform. Cosmic Energy is received to complete Kamen Rider Meteor's transformation.

However, if Ryusei is not exposed to this energy, he is not able to transform. After transforming into Kamen Rider Meteor, he says "Kamen Rider Meteor, your fate is mine to decide!", though [[Joujima Yuki|Yuki]] will yell out "The Meteor is Here!" everytime Meteor arrives in his blue fireball form. His helmet is called the Star Face.

By swapping the Meteor Storm Switch with the Meteor Switch in the Meteor Driver, then spin the fan on the Switch after activating it, he can transform into the stronger Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, gaining in both power and speed. After changing into Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, Ryusei says "Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, my fate will deliver a storm!". His helmet is upgraded into the "Starlight Face".

In this form, he gain the access to a new weapon, the Meteor Storm Shaft, which is a gun rod-like weapon.

title: aerith_gainsborough
body:
Playable character from [[Final Fantasy VII]], featured in the Compilation ([[final fantasy vii advent children|Advent Children]], [[before crisis final fantasy vii|Before Crisis]], [[crisis core final fantasy vii|Crisis Core]]) and the [[final fantasy vii remake|Remake]]. Also a supporting character in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in a [[twisted hair|twisted ponytail]] (often mistakenly depicted as a [[braided ponytail]]) with [[parted bangs]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]], fastened with a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]] and sometimes a visible green [[materia]], [[green eyes]], [[medium breasts]], sometimes [[pale skin]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] ([[puffy short sleeves]] in the original [[Final Fantasy VII|FFVII]]) over a [[long dress|long]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], a [[flower choker]] (simple [[ribbon choker]] prior to [[Final Fantasy VII Remake|FF7R]]) and [[bangle]]s on each wrist. Often carries a [[yellow flower]] and [[flower basket]] and wields a [[staff]].

She was first voiced in English by Mandy Moore in Kingdom Hearts, she was later voiced by Mena Suvari in Kingdom Hearts II and Advent Children, then by Andrea Bowen in Crisis Core and Kingdom Hearts III.  Her voice in the remake and Crisis Core Reunion is performed by Briana White.  Her voice in all Japanese media is performed by [[Sakamoto Maaya]].

First known abroad as [i]Aeris[/i].

title: winchester_model_1887
body:
The [b]Winchester Model 1887[/b] is a [[lever action]] [[shotgun]] designed by [[john moses browning|John Browning]] and produced by the Winchester Repeating Arms Company, maker of the famous [[Winchester model 1873|Winchester rifles]]. It was one of the first successful repeating shotgun designs, but was done so before the proliferation of smokeless gunpowder, which proved too powerful for the design to contain. In addition, [[pump action]] shotguns proved more popular for the new gunpowder mixture, and after the advent of the [[Winchester Model 1897]], interest in the older model quickly waned. 

The Model 1887 was saved from relative obscurity, however, by its use in the 1991 movie [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]], after which the [[weapon]] and the distinctive flip maneuver used to rechamber it became cultural icons. In Anime, the Model 1887 is recognized for its use by [[tsurugi (blue archive)|Tsurugi]] and [[mine (blue archive)|Mine]] in [[Blue Archive]], though even these tend to be done as references themselves to Terminator.

title: heattech_leotard
body:
A [[meme attire|meme outfit]] consisting of a [[turtleneck leotard]] made of a ribbed material resembling a sweater. The outfit is sold by [[Uniqlo]] and is made of HeatTech, a thin material designed to wick away moisture and hold body heat. The outfit comes in [[red leotard|red]], [[black leotard|black]], or [[grey leotard|grey]].

The leotards worn by the [[Shadaloo Dolls]] are visually similar except for the neckties, but they should not be referred as such due to the difference in colors as well as overall design. The leotard as sold by Uniqlo is not a thong leotard and does not have the backless design. Furthermore, it is secured by buttons at the crotch.

This tag used to be referred to as "[[turtleneck leotard]]," but the ambiguity of the tag name led to it being populated by images with literal turtleneck leotards and not necessarily the HeatTech one, thus the need for the rename.

* !asset #24772131

title: vulcan
body:
A fictional humanoid [[alien]] race from the [[Star Trek]] series. They all have straight [[black hair]], [[pointy ears]] and funny eyebrows. 

[b]Vulcans[/b] were one of the first intelligent alien races that made contact with the human race. They are an important part of the [i]United Federation of Planets[/i] and helped to create it with the humans and many other pacific alien races.

Vulcans value logic, harmony, intelligence and serenity above everything else. However, despite their pacifist nature and culture they have super human strength, are very well trained in personal self-defense and can be very smart and highly capable warriors when the situation requires it. They also have very long lifespans.

In their past, Vulcans and [[Romulan]]s shared the same origins and both originated from a barbaric and war-mongering race. As time passed the Vulcan culture changed and evolved into a very intelectual and logic ridden peaceful species. The Romulan race, however, continued with its war-like tendencies.

h4.See also

* [[Spock]]
* [[Vulcan salute]]

title: galaxy_expedition_team_survey_corps_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by members of the Galaxy Expedition Team's Survey Corps in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i]. Almost always worn by [[Akari (pokemon)|]] and [[Rei (pokemon)|]].

The male uniform consists of a tight [[black shirt]], a [[blue kimono]]-like [[jacket]] ([[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]]), an [[obi]] with the Survey Corps' [[satchel]], [[blue pants|blue]] and [[grey pants|grey]] [[gradient pants]], [[grey socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]]. Additionally, Rei wears a [[red scarf]] and a [[red headwear|red]] [[beret]] with a symbol [[print headwear|printed]] on it.

The female uniform consists of a tight [[black shirt]], a [[blue kimono]]-like [[jacket]] ([[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]]), an [[obi]] with the Survey Corps' [[satchel]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] and [[grey skirt|grey]] kimono-like [[gradient skirt]], [[blue leggings]], [[white leg warmers]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]]. Captain [[Cyllene (pokemon)|]], however, wears [[black leggings|black]] and grey [[gradient legwear|gradient]] leggings, and grey socks. Additionally, Akari wears a [[red scarf]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[headscarf]] with a symbol [[print headwear|printed]] on it.

* Rei: post #4381920
* Akari: post #4381919
